## What You Will Learn {.unnumbered}

Volume II extends the foundations into production-scale systems through five parts:

- **Part I: Foundations of Distributed Training** ‚Äî Master the algorithms of scale. Learn how to split massive models across thousands of devices using Data, Tensor, and Pipeline parallelism, and understand the collective communication primitives that coordinate them.
- **Part II: The Machine Learning Fleet** ‚Äî Build the physical supercomputer. Architect the accelerators, power, cooling, and storage systems required to support distributed workloads, and engineer the fault tolerance mechanisms to keep them running.
- **Part III: Deployment & Operations at Scale** ‚Äî Serve the world. Navigate the shift from training throughput to inference latency, push intelligence to the edge, and manage the MLOps lifecycle of production fleets.
- **Part IV: Trustworthy Systems** ‚Äî Harden the system. Tackle the production concerns of robust AI, privacy, security, and sustainability to ensure systems are safe and efficient.
- **Part V: Frontiers** ‚Äî Shape the future. Explore responsible AI governance, AI for social good, and the emerging architecture of AGI systems.

## Prerequisites {.unnumbered}

This volume assumes:

- **Volume I or equivalent** background in single-machine ML systems
- **Programming proficiency** in Python with familiarity in NumPy
- **Mathematics foundations** in linear algebra, calculus, and probability
- Familiarity with distributed systems concepts (networking, parallelism) is helpful for advanced topics
